verses.verse: Howbeit <WH199>, Job <WH347>, I pray thee <WH8085>, hear my speech <WH4405>, And hearken <WH238> to all my words <WH1697>.
Behold now <WH6605>, I have opened my mouth <WH6310>; My tongue <WH3956> hath spoken <WH1696> in my mouth <WH2441>.
My words <WH561> shall utter the uprightness <WH3476> of my heart <WH3820>; And that which my lips <WH8193> know <WH1847> they shall speak <WH4448> sincerely <WH1305>.
The Spirit <WH7307> of God <WH410> hath made <WH6213> me <WH5397>, And the breath of the Almighty <WH7706> giveth me life <WH2421>.
If thou canst <WH3201>, answer <WH7725> thou me <WH6186>; Set thy words in order before <WH6440> me <WH3320>, stand forth.
Behold <WH410>, I am toward God even as thou art <WH6310>: I also am formed <WH7169> out of the clay <WH2563>.
Behold <WH367>, my terror shall not make thee afraid <WH1204>, Neither shall my pressure <WH405> be heavy upon thee <WH3513>.
Surely thou hast spoken <WH559> in my hearing <WH241>, And I have heard <WH8085> the voice <WH6963> of thy words <WH4405>, saying,
I am clean <WH2134>, without transgression <WH6588>; I am innocent <WH2643>, neither is there iniquity in me <WH5771>:
Behold <WH4672>, he findeth occasions <WH8569> against me <WH2803>, He counteth me for his enemy <WH341>:
He putteth <WH7760> my feet <WH7272> in the stocks <WH5465>, He marketh <WH8104> all my paths <WH734>.
Behold <WH6030>, I will answer thee <WH6663>, in this thou art not just; For God <WH433> is greater <WH7235> than man <WH582>.
Why dost thou strive <WH7378> against him <WH6030>, For that he giveth not account of any of his matters <WH1697>?
For God <WH410> speaketh <WH1696> once <WH259>, Yea twice <WH8147>, though man regardeth it not <WH7789>.
In a dream <WH2472>, in a vision <WH2384> of the night <WH3915>, When deep <WH8639> sleep falleth <WH5307> upon men <WH582>, In slumberings <WH8572> upon the bed <WH4904>;
Then he openeth <WH1540> the ears <WH241> of men <WH582>, And sealeth <WH2856> their instruction <WH4561>,
That he may withdraw <WH5493> man <WH120> from his purpose <WH4639>, And hide <WH3680> pride <WH1466> from man <WH1397>;
He keepeth back <WH2820> his soul <WH5315> from the pit <WH7845>, And his life <WH2416> from perishing <WH5674> by the sword <WH7973>.
He is chastened <WH3198> also with pain <WH4341> upon his bed <WH4904>, And with continual <WH7230> strife <WH386> in his bones <WH6106>;
So that his life <WH2416> abhorreth <WH2092> bread <WH3899>, And his soul <WH5315> dainty <WH8378> food <WH3978>.
His flesh <WH1320> is consumed away <WH3615>, that it cannot be seen <WH7210>; And his bones <WH6106> that were not seen <WH7200> stick out <WH8192>.
Yea <WH5315>, his soul draweth near <WH7126> unto the pit <WH7845>, And his life <WH2416> to the destroyers <WH4191>.
If there <WH3426> be with him an angel <WH4397>, An interpreter <WH3887>, one <WH259> among a thousand <WH505>, To show <WH5046> unto man <WH120> what is right for him <WH3476>;
Then God is gracious <WH2603> unto him <WH559>, and saith, Deliver <WH6308> him from going down <WH3381> to the pit <WH7845>, I have found <WH4672> a ransom <WH3724>.
His flesh <WH1320> shall be fresher <WH7375> than a child <WH5290>'s; He returneth <WH7725> to the days <WH3117> of his youth <WH5934>.

He prayeth <WH6279> unto God <WH433>, and he is favorable <WH7521> unto him <WH7200>, So that he seeth his face <WH6440> with joy <WH8643>: And he restoreth <WH7725> unto man <WH582> his righteousness <WH6666>.
He singeth <WH7789> before men <WH582>, and saith <WH559>, I have sinned <WH2398>, and perverted <WH5753> that which was right <WH3477>, And it profited me not <WH7737>:
He hath redeemed <WH6299> my soul <WH5315> from going <WH5674> into the pit <WH7845>, And my life <WH2416> shall behold <WH7200> the light <WH216>.
Lo <WH410>, all these things doth God work <WH6466>, Twice <WH6471>, yea thrice, with a man <WH1397>,
To bring back <WH7725> his soul <WH5315> from the pit <WH7845>, That he may be enlightened <WH215> with the light <WH216> of the living <WH2416>.
Mark well <WH7181>, O Job <WH347>, hearken <WH8085> unto me <WH2790>: Hold thy peace, and I will speak <WH1696>.
If thou hast <WH3426> anything to say <WH4405>, answer <WH7725> me <WH4405>: Speak, for I desire <WH2654> to justify thee <WH6663>.
If not <WH8085>, hearken thou unto me <WH2790>: Hold thy peace, and I will teach <WH502> thee wisdom <WH2451>.
